reviewText: Translation of the Editor's Review of "How Harry Became a Tree" above: In Ireland in the 1920s, Harry's life is upset by two tragedies, the deaths of his wife Anny and her son who fell during the civil war.  Despite that, for a short time, his life continued --  apparently quietly --  in the small house next to a skillet [?] Gus,, the other son. Time passes, and  bit by bit Harry surrenders to depression
